data.name: Canvas Account Registration info
data.value:
Canvas account registration is a service aimed at employees of Swedish government agencies who are enrolled in a commissioned education program at Södertörn University.

Canvas account registration is used to register an EduId account for use in the Canvas Learning Management System. Once the registered account has been reviewed and approved, it will be transferred to the Canvas Learning Management System, and the user will be able to log in with their EduId.

data.name: Privacy info
data.value:
Processing of Personal Data

Transfer of Personal Data

Personal data is transferred from the identity provider (your login service) to Canvas Account Registration to enable Södertörn University to verify the user's identity, allowing the user to participate in their education.

When logging into this service, the following personal data is requested from the identity provider you use:

Personal Data Purpose Technical Representation
Unique Identifier To grant you access to educational materials in the Canvas LMS eduPersonPrincipalName
Name The name is used in lists and other interfaces displayName
First Name The first name is used in lists and other interfaces givenName
Last Name The last name is used in lists and other interfaces sn
Email Address Used to contact you email
Unique User ID Used to uniquely identify you within the service eduPersonUniqueId
Role and Organizational Affiliation Describes your role and relationship to the organization eduPersonScopedAffiliation
Personal Identity Number Used to identify you nationally personalIdentityNumber
Assurance level Used for assessing the level of assurance (LoA) of a user's identity eduPersonAssurance

In addition to direct personal data, indirect personal data such as the organization the user belongs to and the identity provider used during login is also transferred. Combined with the above data, this information can be used to uniquely identify a person.

Transfer of Personal Data to Third Parties

Personal data processed within Canvas Account Registration may be shared with third parties if necessary to provide the service or if required by law. In such cases, the university ensures that the recipient handles the data in accordance with applicable data protection regulations.

Legal Basis

The processing of personal data in the Canvas Account Registration service is part of Södertörn University's exercise of official authority. Fulfilling legal obligations may also, in some cases, serve as the legal basis for the service.

Right to Access, Rectification, and Erasure of Personal Data

To request access to, rectification of, or erasure of your personal data, contact the data controller.

To rectify personal data transferred during login, make the correction with the identity provider you use to log in. These changes will be reflected in the service upon your next login after the corrections are made in the identity provider.

Retention of Personal Data

Personal data processed within Canvas Account Registration is retained only as long as necessary to fulfill the purpose of the service. When you no longer use the service, your personal data will be erased in accordance with the university's data storage and retention policies.

Data Controller

The data controller for the processing of personal data is Södertörn University, Sweden. If you have questions about how personal data is handled within the service, contact dataskydd@sh.se.

Contact details for Södertörn University's Data Protection Officer can be found on this page.

GÉANT Data Protection Code of Conduct

This service adheres to the international framework GÉANT Data Protection Code of Conduct for transferring personal data from identity providers to the service. The framework is intended for services in Sweden, the EU, and the EEA used in research and higher education.

data.name: Privacy
data.value: Transfer of Personal Data to the Service in Connection with Federated Login (Privacy Policy)

data.name: Successfull registration
data.value: You have successfully registered your EduId account!

data.name: Please verify account
data.value: You have not verified your account with bank ID yet. click here to log out from this application. After that log into EduId to verify your account. Then return here to check that your account is verified.

data.name: Registration approved
data.value:
You don’t need to do anything else. When an administrator has added your account to Canvas, you will receive an email with instructions on how to log in to the Canvas Study Web.

The email will be sent to the address you have linked to your eduID.
If you have not received an email within two working days, please contact info@sh.se

data.name: Instructions
data.value:
Create an Account to Access the SMOB Course

Sweden Against Organized Crime (SMOB) is an excellence initiative aimed at strengthening Sweden's ability to combat organized crime, with a particular focus on the criminal economy. Read more about SMOB here.

All courses within SMOB are offered via Södertörn University's learning platform, Studiewebben Canvas.

As a participant in a SMOB course, you will use an eduID to log in to Canvas.

Follow these instructions to create an eduID:

  1. Create your eduID. Open a new browser window and go to eduid.se and create an account. Important! You must use the email address you have in the service as the username for your eduID.
  2. Verify your eduID. Once you have created your account on eduID, you should verify it with your BankID or Freja+. Go to eduID's homepage and click on the link "Identity" under the heading "Verify your identity". Follow the instructions on the page to verify your account with BankID or Freja+.
  3. Register your eduID on Södertörn University's Canvas. Click on the link: Canvas account registration page. Use your eduID, i.e. the email address and password you chose when you registered.
  4. Confirm that your eduID is registered. You will now see a confirmation that your eduID is registered in the Canvas account registration. Once an administrator has reviewed and approved your account, you will gain access to Studiewebben Canvas. You will use your eduID to log in to Canvas going forward.

data.name: NotFoundMessage
data.value: We apologize, but the page you were looking for does not seem to exist. This may be because the page has been moved, removed, or an incorrect link was used. If you continue to experience issues, please contact biblioteket@sh.se.

data.name: CanvasInstruction
data.value:
Instructions for logging into Södertörn University's learning platform Canvas:

You have been given an account in Södertörn University's learning platform Canvas and can log in to access your education.

  • Use the link studiewebben.instructure.com to access the login page for Canvas.
  • Select the option "Log in with EduId."
  • Log in with your EduId.

Review which notifications you want to receive

You control which notifications/alerts you receive from Canvas. Click on Account > Notifications and enable the notifications you want to receive from the system.

You will receive an email when you are added to a course

Don't see the course yet? We are working on it and will notify you via email once you are enrolled in the course.

Do you have any questions or concerns?

Contact ikt-pedagogerna@sh.se

data.name: EduIdInstruction
data.value:
Create account

As a guest in the Canvas Study Web you need an eduID to be able to log in. Follow these instructions to create an eduID:

  1. Create your eduID. Open a new browser window and go to eduid.se and create an account.
  2. Once you have created your eduID, return to this website to continue the process.

After you have created your eduID

You need to register your eduID with us to gain access to the Canvas Study Web.

Register your eduID by clicking on Student or Staff. Use your eduID when logging in, i.e. the email address and password you chose when you registered for eduID.

You will now see a confirmation that your eduID is registered in the Canvas account registration. Once an administrator has reviewed and approved your account, you will get access to Canvas. You will use your eduID to log in to Canvas from now on. Here you can find instructions on how to log in to Canvas.
